description: vulgar +‎ -ian. Compare Late Latin vulgārius, Latin vulgāris.

adjectives.description: vulgarian (comparative more vulgarian, superlative most vulgarian)

entries.meaning: Having the characteristics of a vulgarian, vulgar.
A vulgar individual, especially one who emphasizes or is oblivious to his or her vulgar qualities.
examples: He was by this time on the deck, but he had the art to be quite unapproachable; the friendliest vulgarian, three parts drunk, would have known better than take liberties...
